div.div:
***Please note changes in Food Delivery Service process.***
In keeping with the guidelines recommended by the CDC and Governor Beshear's office, Glasgow Independent Schools will be updating the food service schedule.
Beginning Monday, April 13, 2020, Glasgow Independent Schools will have meals available for pick up at the school cafeterias listed below. Meals can be picked up on Monday and Thursday between 10:00 am and 12:00 pm. BEGINNING APRIL 13, 2020, THERE WILL BE NO MORE FOOD SERVICE DELIVERIES TO HOMES.
Highland Elementary: 164 Scottie Dr., 270-659-0432
South Green Elementary: 300 James T. Rogers Rd., 270-651-2443
Glasgow Middle School: 105 Scottie Dr., 270-659-0503
Glasgow High School: 1601 Columbia Ave., 270-651-7245
Please visit the following website, https://www.foodsafety.gov/keep-food-safe/4-steps-to-food-safety for food safety and preparation tips. Due to the availability of food at this time, we may be serving items that are not typically served in GIS district. Please check for allergens on all packaged food.
If you have any questions, please contact your child's respective school or Stacy Jessie at 270-651-8779.

img.div:
Our regular office hours for the Glasgow Independent Schools Central Office will be changing to a hybrid schedule beginning Monday, March 30, 2020.
The front lobby will be OPEN weekly on Monday and Thursday from 8:00 am to 1:00 pm. If you need assistance any other time please call 270-651-6757.

a.title: SCHOOL BOARD MEETING LIVE STREAM
a.div:
Due to the COVID-19 Pandemic, all GIS School Board meetings will be done via video conferencing and live streamed on youtube until further notice. Click anywhere on this box and you will be connected to the livestream.
https://youtu.be/Bdg9H0TUCqs

div.span: CHANGE IN SCHOOL CALENDAR AND EXTENSION OF NTI DAYS

img.alt: CHANGE IN SCHOOL CALENDAR AND EXTENSION OF NTI DAYS
img.div:
Glasgow Independent Schools has made the decision to continue with our NTI instruction days through Spring Break. Instead of Spring Break, NTI instruction will continue. This will move our last day of school for Preschool and K-12 students to May 14th.
The current meal delivery schedule of Monday and Thursday will continue during the week of April 6-10.
If you have any questions, please contact the Central Office at 270-651-6757.

img.div:
Welcome from Glasgow Independent Schools!
Thank you for taking the time to visit our district website and allowing us to share a few of the outstanding successes of our students. Glasgow Independent Schools has a proud tradition of academic excellence and an environment of inspiring greatness. Our students are offered multiple opportunities for success in academics, the arts, extra-curricular activities and athletics. We are committed in personalizing each child's educational plan to help him/her reach his/her full potential. This commitment pushes our administration to continuously look at ways to maximize each child's educational experience. Our students, community and staff are proud of our district and understand what it means to be a "Glasgow Scottie" and we welcome you to join us.
Please do not hesitate to contact myself or any of our building administrators to learn more about our schools and district.
Yours in Education,
Keith Hale

div.div:
The Glasgow Board of Education is accepting sealed bids for the purchase of the following for the 2020-2021 school year: bus maintenance, gasoline, diesel fuel and motor oil. Bid documents may be picked up at the Central Office, 711 S. L. Rogers Wells Blvd., PO Box 1239, Glasgow, KY, 42141, and must be returned before 12:00 pm, CDT, Thursday, May 21, 2020. Bids will be opened at this time and evaluated. Bids sent via US mail must be clearly marked with “Bid Enclosed”. The Board reserves the right to reject any and all bids.
Glasgow Board of Education
Amelia Kiser, Chairman
Keith Hale, Superintendent/Secretary

div.span: Glasgow Independent Schools Pandemic Preparation Plan Summary

div.div:
With any potential pandemic event, Glasgow Independent Schools follows CDC recommendations and stays in close communication with the Barren County Health Department to monitor the situation, ensure proper disease control protocols are implemented, and determine best steps to protect the health of students, staff, and the community. Following is a summary of the district plan regarding the spread of contagious disease:
Preparedness
● A contagious viral event plan is in place to ensure proper steps are taken to address the spread of highly contagious diseases.
● Plan is reviewed to ensure proper implementation in the case of a potential pandemic event.
● The Glasgow Independent Schools Health Services Coordinator works in close connection with the Barren County Health Department to maintain awareness of potential health threats and proper protocols to protect the health of students and staff.
Prevention
● Student and staff absences are monitored and close communication with the health department is maintained to determine broader risks in the community.
● Custodial practices will be reviewed to ensure that schools and buses are maintaining a clean and sanitized environment.
● Continual communication with Barren County Health Department occurs to monitor progression of the disease, ensure best practices for prevention, and secure resources to educate the students, staff and community.
Advanced Precautions
● Increase awareness among staff, students, and community regarding best practices to prevent the spread of contagious diseases.
● Enhanced disinfectant practices including broader distribution of disinfectant wipes and sanitizers as well as fogging of buses and school buildings after hours will occur.
● Continual communication with Barren County Health Department occurs to monitor progression of disease, ensure best practices for prevention, and secure resources to educate the students, staff and community.
Monitoring, Reporting and Heightened Awareness
● Glasgow Independent Schools will be notified of the presence of the virus in Kentucky.
● School officials will intensify monitoring processes and maintain close communication with the Barren County Health Department.
● School officials will follow preventative protocols related to large assemblies and travel as directed by the Barren County Health Department.
● School based nurses will evaluate any student or staff member exhibiting symptoms and determine if further testing is needed. Those who are suspected of possible infection will be sent home and referred to their family physician.
Preparation for Possible School Closures
● Barren County Health Department will notify school officials if there is a confirmed case in Barren County.
● Schools will review non-traditional instructional plans with students and parents in preparation for possible school closures. School Closures
● Glasgow Independent Schools will activate school closure procedures. Families will be notified through school announcements, social media outlets, and our one-call system.
● Non-traditional instructional day protocols will be followed.
● Length of school closures will be determined in close communication with local health officials.

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
